description.narrative: The development Objective of the project is to increase access to HIV/AIDS and STI-related services by high-risk groups in the Recipient's territory.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II.A.2 | Description :As part of the project annual reviews, IDA and the Government willreview the amounts to be committed by the Government for ARV treatment for the following year. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV.B.1 (b)(i) ) | Description :(i) The Output-based Financing Procedures Manual has beenadopted in form and substance acceptable to IDA, and grant provided in accordance with agreed-upon procedures and terms andconditions | Due Date :31-Dec-2014

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV.B.1 (b)(ii) | Description :(ii) The Independent Evaluator has been recruited, and theproposed payment has been verified for accuracy and eligibility, and deemed consistent with the performance targets and otherprovisions | Due Date :31-Dec-2014

title.narrative: Sex worker using a condom at their most recent sexual encounter
RBF contracts signed with health centers
RBF pilot design validated by Government of Niger/MOH/CISLS
Number of pregnant women tested for HIV and who know their results during the past year
Number of condoms distributed to sex workers by NGOs
Number of reports produced by the national program according to the agreed standards (template, deadline and quality)
Number of sex workers seen at health facilities after referral by NGOs
Number of sex workers referred to health facilities for services by NGOs
Number of stakeholders meetings per year at central and regional levels
Pilot health districts with RBF results fully verified by independent third party
Number of sex workers treated for STI
Percentage of positive pregnant women who received a complete prophylaxis treatment for the mother-to-child transmission
